descrp: This course explores the most important cultural contributions of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden. It touches upon the shared history and culture, and then focuses on the eighteenth-, nineteenth-, and twentieth-century developments in literature, theater, film, art, design, music, and contemporary political and social issues, such as the welfare state, crime fiction, and recent immigration.  Readings will include fairy tales, plays, and novels, to be complemented by film and other visual materials. Taught in English with readings in English.
name: Literature and Culture of the Nordic World
